sentence.Network_en: I'll be able to take a few more griddle cakes back.
sentence.Network_cn: 得了,回头好多带回几个饼子去!

sentence.Network_en: A stomach full of griddle cake stuffed with stewed meat , now that's what really counted!
sentence.Network_cn: 穿着破衣,而把烙饼卷酱肉吃在肚中, 这是真的!

sentence.Network_en: He looked around at the others, nodded, and took another bite of griddle cake.
sentence.Network_cn: 转圈看了大家一眼, 点了点头, 又咬了一截饼.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting a gridiron): from Old French gredil, from Latin craticula, diminutive of cratis 'hurdle'; related to crate, grate, and grill

entry.def: A griddle is a round, flat, heavy piece of metal which is placed on a cooker or fire and used for cooking.

means.word_mean: 1. cooking utensil consisting of a flat heated surface (as on top of a stove) on which food is cooked
